fields.description:
When all the player units have finished attacking, nothing happens. To let the enemies attack, I have to move the cursor to an empty space, press Z and select "END TURN". I bet you did that on purpose!

It's a good idea, to let the player do stuff before enemy attacks, but it would be better, if the players stopped attacking, a "2" comes up on the screen, and it count down to 0, then the enemy attacks. If the player presses "ESC" during the countdown, the game will wait until you select "END TURN".

Do you not think this is MUCH better?
fields.summary: End-of-turn enchancement/bug? (3.01)

fields.description:
In the changeset view, code is being recognized as HTML symbol entities.

For example:\\
&sub becomes ⊂\\
&and becomes ∧\\
&or becomes ∨

The exact occurence in my code is:\\
&&sub becomes &⊂\\
etc.

This does not happen when viewing the source code from the Source tab.
fields.summary: Code being recognized as HTML symbol entities in the changeset view.

fields.description:
I don't know if this is a problem with my ISP (I use EDGE) or something went wrong with repo/bitbucket, but from yesterday I can't push a changeset to bitbucket.

Using HTTP I get this:

{{{\\
gforgx@laptop> hg -v --debug push                                    ~/code/notefinder\\
using http://bitbucket.org/gforgx/notefinder\\
sending between command\\
real URL is http://bitbucket.org/gforgx/notefinder/\\
pushing to http://bitbucket.org/gforgx/notefinder\\
sending capabilities command\\
capabilities: unbundle=HG10GZ,HG10BZ,HG10UN lookup changegroupsubset\\
sending heads command\\
searching for changes\\
common changesets up to 0cb4d54769dd\\
1 changesets found\\
list of changesets:\\
b98d37cacc609f22c8a5ea58a0d11761e5818f91\\
sending unbundle command\\
sending 2290 bytes\\
}}}

After this it does nothing, no messages like "broken pipe" or "http timeout" appear.

Using SSH:\\
{{{\\
gforgx@laptop> hg -v --debug push                              ~/code/notefinder\\
running ssh -C hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R gforgx/notefinder serve --stdio"\\
sending hello command\\
sending between command\\
Enter passphrase for key '/home/gforgx/.ssh/id_rsa':\\
remote: 48\\
remote: capabilities: unbundle lookup changegroupsubset\\
remote: 1\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/gforgx/notefinder\\
sending heads command\\
searching for changes\\
common changesets up to 0cb4d54769dd\\
1 changesets found\\
list of changesets:\\
b98d37cacc609f22c8a5ea58a0d11761e5818f91\\
sending unbundle command\\
remote: Read from remote host bitbucket.org: Operation timed out\\
abort: unexpected response: empty string

}}}\\
If this matters, I'm using mercurial 1.3 under FreeBSD 8.0-BETA1.

P. S. Attached raw changeset.
fields.summary: Can't push
Zoom with CategoryAxisRenderer doesn't work properly

fields.description:
I have a repository here ( http://bitbucket.org/pedersen/tg_2_1_docs/ ) that is actually a fork of another repository ( http://bitbucket.org/mramm/tg_2_1_docs/ ), but I did not make my fork using the fork button.

I also have people who since forked from my repository.

Is there any way for me to update info about my fork to show that I really did fork this other project? Or to have bitbucket make this change?

I know, it's a small/silly thing, but I want people to be able to see the lineage, and be able to find the fork if they start on the original's page.
fields.summary: Need To Reset Fork

fields.description:
The auto-generated table of contents on a page of mine is really messed up:\\
http://bitbucket.org/snej/mynetwork/wiki/BLIP/Protocol

Note all of the junk with descriptions of bugs. I think what's happening is that the links to in-page anchors for the various sections are being mis-interpreted by the wiki parser as references to bugs, since they start with a "#" and then the section title, which starts with a number.

I think this is a regression since I first created the page a few months ago, because I probably would have noticed this when viewing it right after I added the toc macro!
fields.summary: TOC macro generates bogus links to bugs, if section titles start with numbers

fields.description:
Summary: Once a user uploads an avatar, they are unable to remove it, to use a gravatar instead.

Initially, when I joined BitBucket, I uploaded an image as my avatar. Later on, I discovered what gravatars were, and now would like to use my gravatar for BitBucket. How do I do this? There seems to be no way to switch to a gravatar.

If this is not yet possible, can someone please manually reset my avatar? It's seriously bugging me! Thanks.
fields.summary: No way to remove avatar and use Gravatar

fields.description:
This makes it easier to identify private repositories and it's more consistent.

See attached screenshot what I mean.
fields.summary: Home view: Use the same translucent lock-icons as in the toolbar.

fields.description:
I'm accessing bitbucket repos via HTTPS via my company proxy. Currently everything works fine as long as it doesn't need to authenticate -- e.g. clone and pull, and push when there are no changes.

But when I try to push, and it asks for password, I type the password, then get "Authorization failed" after a 3-5 second pause.
fields.summary: Cannot authenticate when pushing via https proxy

fields.description:
The project RSS feed for my project

http://bitbucket.org/tshead/k3d-sandbox/rss/

is out-of-date - it only list changes through 7/10, whereas the project page

http://bitbucket.org/tshead/k3d-sandbox/

is completely up-to-date, displaying changes through 7/14, and so is my user feed.

Thanks in advance,\\
Tim
fields.summary: Per-project RSS feed out-of-date

fields.description:
My recent commits (as morais, to my private repository) no longer are associated with my profile/phote.

I'm guessing this is related to having changed my email address in the settings (was @gmail.com, now it's @cubicteam.com)?

My local ~/.hgrc includes:

{{{\\
[ui]\\
username = Pedro Morais [EMAILHERE%40cubicteam.com]\\
}}}

and that's the same email used in the profile.
fields.summary: Associate profile to commits stops working

fields.description:
On the previous bug tracker I used, I was able to mark issues as private, hiding them from the general public. This was useful for keeping track of issues that had security implications, or regarded a certain exploit that was not a good idea to just post to the public.

I'm not sure the best way to implement such a thing in this system would be, but it's probably fair to say that repo admins at the very least would be able to see private issues, possibly repo writers could see them as well.
fields.summary: Ability to create private issues (BB-251)

fields.description: In the "Repositories" the "Create new" entry is the first entry. In the "Issues" for a repo, "Create new" is the last entry. It probably makes sense to be consistent with the placement.
fields.summary: Inconsistent placement of "create new" in menus

fields.description:
Hi! I tried many times wiki's TOC on directory feature, but, without any success :-( Every time I got an error\\
Wiki macro error: Either directory does not exist or no files found.

I use an empty sandbox repo and real one, but, the results are the same. What are files there?

{{{\\
$ tree\\
.\\
|-- FAQ\\
|   |-- bar.wiki\\
|   |-- baz.wiki\\
|   {{-- foo.wiki |-- FAQ.wiki}}-- Home.wiki\\
}}}

hg clone http://bitbucket.org/tickling/test-repo/wiki/

{{{\\
$ hg log\\
1[tip]   92ad6915e73e   2009-07-10 20:04 +0300   sergei\\
test toc on dir

0   c9ae28932f0a   2009-07-10 19:01 +0200   bitbucket\\
Automated commit message\\
}}}

Well, I tried {{{<<toc FAQ/>>}}} and {{{<<to FAQ/ 3>>}}} as described here http://bitbucket.org/help/FAQ/wiki#how-can-i-add-a-table-of-content

Thanks, if you have read until here :-)
fields.summary: Toc on dir does not work

fields.description: Is it possible to add a way to suppress a line numbering for the code snippets or (and) start numbering from a specified number? Excuse me, if I missed something, if it is, please, enlighten me how to do it. Thanks.
fields.summary: An ability to supress line numbering in the pygment's lexer

fields.description: As I am unable to hg clone my private repo behind the corporate firewall, it would be rather neat if I could have the option to download a tarball of the current working copy, i.e. a archived copy of hg clone.
fields.summary: Download archived working copy

fields.description: I recently had the unpleasant job of needing to remove someone from a repository. This sends out an email notification. It'd be nice if it didn't so it could happen more quietly.
fields.summary: It would be nice if removing someone wouldn't notify them (BB-721)

fields.description:
Right now snapshot URLs are like:

https://bitbucket.org/gforgx/notefinder/get/0.5.3.zip

It'd be great if bitbucket would add project prefix to "filename" so it would be like:

https://bitbucket.org/gforgx/notefinder/get/notefinder-0.5.3.zip

Maybe you could make this at least optional.

Thanks for BitBucket!
fields.summary: Snapshot URLs

fields.description:
Example link:

http://bitbucket.org/barttc/django-authority/src/tip/example/exampleapp/permissions.py#cl-48

Would be nice if the line 48 is highlighted if I open the page.
fields.summary: Highlight the source line if you link to it's anchor

fields.description: I've got a couple repositories that I only keep up for archival reasons. It's actually slightly irritating (then again, I'm the type to garbage-collect forks often, so maybe I'm weird). It'd be really great if there was a way to indicate that a project was inactive (and maybe disallow all pushing to inactive-flagged repos?) so it wouldn't show in the quick-access repo dropdown list.
fields.summary: Mark Repo as "archived" or "inactive" (BB-720)

fields.description: One of the nice things about github is immediately seeing code when viewing a repo. In bitbucket you are forced to make an extra click. A user preference to automatically take me to the Source tab would be ideal regardless of what the owner of the repository has configured.
fields.summary: Option to default to Source tab instead of Overview

fields.description: For readability, it'd be best that the paragraphs would be 65-80ex wide on the wiki. If it's wider, it will become tiresome for the eyes.
fields.summary: The wiki layout is too wide

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I've  ofcz jar file and kept in lib directory and I tried your example (line.zul) while running i'm getting following error. please help how to resolve this error.

org.zkoss.zk.ui.UiException: Sourced file: inline evaluation of: {{. . . '' : Error in method invocation: Method setXAxis( jofc2.model.axis.XAxis ) not found in class'jofc2.model.elements.LineChart' : at Line: 65 : in file: inline evaluation of:}}              import ofc.OFC;         import jofc2.model.Chart;         import j . . . '' : lineChart .setXAxis ( lcXAxis )

Called from method: getLineChart : at Line: 85 : in file: inline evaluation of: {{import ofc.OFC; import jofc2.model.Chart; import j . . . '' : getLineChart ( ) Called from method: initializeLineChartDataOnCreate : at Line: 99 : in file: inline evaluation of:}}                                                                                 . . . '' : initializeLineChartDataOnCreate ( )\\
sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)

Thanks, &\\
Dhana
fields.summary: chart problem

fields.description: I get auto logged out when I post a new issue. The issue gets posted but I have to login.
fields.summary: Auto Logout (BB-648)

fields.description:
i was wondering, if maybe bitbucket could provide some more community features:

* like voting for best projects monthly
* make project spotlights
* maybe something more that comes to your mind ?
* "looking for volunteers" so developers can search and clearly see that a project is currently looking for participators

im sure there are many interesting projects out there that without any advertising like that wont see the broader audience

also that would make bitbucket stronger in general and maybe encourage the community for better activity.

I was also wondering if there is place for a very simple forum for projects ? issue tracker is not that bad for discussion, but forum would be a better place, event the simpliest forum would do i guess.
fields.summary: more community features on bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi, I tried to use this TOC semantic: *<<toc FAQ/>>*. It's very great and cool macro which helps to split FAQ's entries on the small files. Suddenly, I found that it does not work for me.\\
It's bug? example:\\
http://bitbucket.org/tickling/test-repo/wiki/FAQ

Every time I get such an error when I try to browse FAQ entry\\
*Wiki macro error: Either directory does not exist or no files found.*

But, FAQ/* is there (in wiki's repo)! The syntax is valid. I even did tried push in the bb's help content there. No results. I found no issues about on the tracker. Please, enlighten me, what is wrong with the macro?

Thanks for your patience!
fields.summary: Wiki's TOC macro issue

fields.description: Added the email-diff service to 3 of my projects and no emails ever get sent out.  The regular email service works fine, but the email-diff does not send out any emails.
fields.summary: email-diff service does not work (BB-371)

fields.description: I've tried computers on 3 different networks and each one says bitbucket.org is unreachable. I can view the page in a browser, but with mercurial or ping it's a no-go.
fields.summary: Bitbucket.org timing out on commit

fields.description:
Hi,

I tried to execute your code (open flash) with ofcz-0.2.jar but its not working . I got following error.

SEVERE: Servlet.service() for servlet zkLoader threw exception\\
org.zkoss.zk.ui.UiException: Sourced file: inline evaluation of: {{. . . '' : Typed variable declaration : Class: XAxis not found in namespace : at Line: 21 : in file: inline evaluation of:}}                import ofc.OFC;         import jofc2.model.Chart;         import . . . '' : XAxis

Called from method: getLineChart : at Line: 87 : in file: inline evaluation of: {{import ofc.OFC; import jofc2.model.Chart; import . . . '' : getLineChart ( ) Called from method: initializeLineChartDataOnCreate : at Line: 101 : in file: inline evaluation of:}}

Thanks,\\
Dhana
fields.summary: Error in open flash code

fields.description:
In mercurial there are (now) 11 revisons. When I want to update to i.e. rev. 10 an error message is delivered:

"*** case-folding collision between Base/Ds/Sig/Dcmfl/rmat.src and Base/Ds/Sig/Dcmfl/Rmat.src\\
[command interrupted]"

(supposed) reason: I accidently included file "rmat.src" earlier and file "Rmat.src" to revision 3 (same directory).\\
Op. system: W-XP (and W2k); archive built with revision 0.4 (now updated to 0.7.5). It is possible to commit further versions; version check doesn't report _any_ error.

How can I get my revisions back (no matter to loose _both_ files rmat.src because I have a copy) ???\\
Kind regards, U. Huff\\
(huff.ulrich@foerstergroup.de)
fields.summary: _suppose_! bug in mercurial: can't update to older revisions

fields.description: When sending messages to myself, I can delete them from inbox, but not from "sent messages"
fields.summary: Cannot delete messages sent to myself from "sent messages" (BB-719)

fields.description: If you receive a message that doesn't have a title, you can't view it anymore because there's nothing to click on. At first there's an "unread dot", but that disappears after the first time the message is seen.
fields.summary: Cannot view messages with no title (BB-718)
HTTPS security compromised by insecure script download

fields.description:
Currently it's not possible to access the project's wiki hg repository over SSH:\\
{{{\\
% hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/intgr/pyperfcounter/wiki/\\
remote: abort: There is no Mercurial repository here (.hg not found)!\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!\\
}}}

However, one would expect this to be possible, considering that Bitbucket uses similar URL layouts for HTTP(S) and SSH.
fields.summary: Cloning wiki over SSH

fields.description:
When trying to upload a file from IE 8 I get the message "You must enter a filename" (which I did, using the "Browse" button) after clicking the "Upload" button, and the file did not upload.

Uploading the same file from Firefox 3 worked fine.

Also, the "You must enter a filename" message isn't very noticeable.
fields.summary: Uploads do not seem to work from IE 8

fields.description:
If you go to http://bitbucket.org/news/

bq. Janus Dam Nielsen committed d9b3bceab2f5 to viff\\
Updated filename in description of beginner.py\\
just now


Has been listed as "just now" for at least a week.
fields.summary: Same first item in the public newsfeed for a week^Wyear (BB-47)

fields.description:
A blog post on how the feature works: http://github.com/blog/39-say-hello-to-the-network-graph-visualizer

Here's a use-case:

I've forked project foo. I've been hacking on it for a while and haven't been paying attention to what's been going on in the mainline foo repository. I know that _some_ of my changes have been pulled in, but don't know when that last was. The Network graph would allow me to easily see this.

Similarly, if I maintain project bar, it allows me to see, at a glance, changes in the various forks of my project.

UI doesn't have to be identical, or even similar -- but I've found that those two tasks are quite common and I don't see a good way of accomplishing them in the current UI. If I've missed something, feel free to let me know :)

Bitbucket rules, btw.
fields.summary: Bitbucket should have somthing like Github's Network graph (BB-336)

fields.description:
For paid plans (those supporting CNAME extension) it would be really nice to get the ability to personalize the page logo (at the top left of the page).

In the same way that I like the idea of having the company's url, I'd like to be able to have the company's logo.

In that case, the bitbucket references should appear at the bottom of the page.

Does it sound reasonable?
fields.summary: Personalized Logo

fields.description:
I created a new repository "cvx++" and followed the "Importing existing files" instructions, but was unable to push:

$ hg push https://mihelich@bitbucket.org/mihelich/cvx++\\
pushing to https://mihelich@bitbucket.org/mihelich/cvx++\\
real URL is https://bitbucket.org/mihelich/cvx%2B%2B/\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: mihelich\\
password:\\
abort: authorization failed

I tried the same with another new repository named "cvxpp" and all is well, so I guess the '+' characters are a problem.
fields.summary: Cannot push to repository

fields.description:
# Go to http://bitbucket.org/Scaevolus/skybot/changeset/eac22aa6ca72/
# Look at line 20, and compare it to line 20 at http://bitbucket.org/Scaevolus/skybot/src/eac22aa6ca72/plugins/twitter.py

It looks like it's not escaping ampersands, making my ">" in code appear as ">" when viewed in a web browser.
fields.summary: Changeset view does not properly handle escaping HTML entities

fields.description:
Hi,

actually on my homepage, i can see i am following these people and these projects, but what about issues i choose to follow?\\
Can it be possible to add information about issues followed on the homepage? (and maybe even other objects which can be followed).

If the problem is that the following section will be too big to be usable, maybe separating each type (people, projects, issues....) with a bit of javascript (to ease expand/compact) can be possible.
fields.summary: Listing followed issues on the following page (BB-652)

fields.description:
* When the wiki has data make it the home and lose the wiki menu item
* make repo-desc two lines high
* add a small div with link to all text files in the project root
* show project pulse - a committer-colored small commit graph
* add a small div with titles of last issues
* add a small div with featured downloads
fields.summary: project home page suggestion

fields.description:
When I'm not logged in and I want to follow a repository, I'm redirected to a login page:

http://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/gregnewman/django-loupe/follow/

When I validate the login form, it doesn't redirect to the project's page but does lots of follow/unfollow requests. The behaviour is the same when going to:

http://bitbucket.org/gregnewman/django-loupe/follow/

as a logged in user.

See the attached picture, I have quite a lot of messages :)
fields.summary: Incorrect redirection when following from Anonymous or non-AJAX request

fields.description:
Any chance we could get syntax highlighting for (Markdown) README files that are displayed with the source?

Here's a simple example that could benefit: http://bitbucket.org/sjl/hg-prompt/src/
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for README files

fields.description:
hi, i am trying to download a video which needs age confirmation so i used the following command:

youtube-dl.py -u myusername http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SRnXkrHFcH0

the strange thing is the difference in the output of the program depending on the version used. I have been happy using the 2008.04.20 version, with which i obtained:

Type YouTube password and press return:

Logging in... done.

Confirming age... done.

Retrieving video webpage... done.

Extracting URL "t" parameter... failed.

ERROR: unable to extract URL "t" parameter.

so i decided to use the latest version (2009.05.30) and obtained a python error with unicode and stuff, without even requesting my password. My question is, how can i download my video?

P.D.:i've never used -u option before, i guess that's what it is for.
fields.summary: -t, -u parameters and a difference between versions

fields.description: Self-explanatory.
fields.summary: add CAPTCHA to issue tracker to stop all the spam
Dial-up Support / Long Dwnlds. (100+ mins.)

fields.description:
I'm getting a shitload of spam on pickywiki, e.g., http://bitbucket.org/ianb/pickywiki/issue/156/youre-just-awesome-groot-nu-kan-ik-zeggen-dank-uvqoe

No other projects, just this one, despite turning off the issue tracker entirely.  Something weird is going on here.  But mostly I'm just tired of getting all these notification messages from pickywiki spam.
fields.summary: pickywiki spam

fields.description:
Hello,

We have problems receiving emails that should warn us when a new comment for an issue has been added.  I am the administrator of our repository and my user is marketforecastgroup.  The repository is marketforecastgroup/mfg.  I have also added another user name which is giulio to see if at least with that other user I was receiving the emails and instead I do not.  I have for both users checked the "following" (heart) option.  Could you please verify if you can find a way for all the subscribers of the repository to receive emails?

Thank you,

Giulio
fields.summary: Problems with receiving notice emails

fields.description: I tried to install TracGantt for trac 0.11 but it doesn't appear in my list of plugins
fields.summary: TracGantt does not appear in list of installed plugins

fields.description:
The text fields in the issue tracker and wiki are too small for normal use if JavaScript is disabled -- please make them larger by default. The 'preview' box should be hidden in the issue tracker as it's empty.

Also the issue query interface should have a notice that it does not work without JavaScript.

(This affects more people than you might expect; NoScript has become a pretty popular Firefox extension. It has over half a million downloads weekly alone!)
fields.summary: Issue tracker/wiki fields tiny without JavaScript

fields.description:
Hi Jesper,

Can we have some rough code statistics on BitBucket to give an idea of the progress and productivity of someone working on a project?

I personally use this script - http://bitbucket.org/swaroopch/misc/src/tip/code_statistics.py to get an idea of the amount of work I put in each day.

It would be useful if I can just visit bitbucket.org to see the same :)

Thanks,\\
Swaroop
fields.summary: Statistics? (BB-502)

fields.description: It would be nice to have an issue type for things that just should be done. (I use that a lot in trac).
fields.summary: add issue type: task (BB-717)

fields.description:
I've just tried setting up CIA.vc for hgsubversion. Basically, it sucks. We have several queues — which are the most interesting to receive notifications from — and one main development repository. I'd rather not have to create projects for each and every queue, but it seems the module argument to CIA is somewhat broken, so I have no choice but to do so.

It would be mighty nice if Bitbucket instead offered its own IRC notification service. I know it's much easier to ask for it than to do it, though…
fields.summary: Add IRC notifications as a native service (BB-716)

fields.description: I tend to get a lot of anonymous people unable to figure out how to add an attachment to a ticket (and then proceeeding to paste it in the body text, formatting messed up in the process and so on). Perhaps point out more explicitly that registering is needed for attachments?
fields.summary: Anonymous users unable to figure out ticket attachments (BB-715)

fields.description:
I am an administrator and we have already 5  writers (including myself) and 2 administrator (including myself) but somehow I am now no longer able to add them.

Thank you,

Giulio
fields.summary: Adding writers problem

fields.description:
we are several writers and 2 administrators.  I am an administrator but I do not get all the messages that are comments on issues.  I have a gmail account but others have also one and they do receive them.

Thanks,

Giulio
fields.summary: mail problems

fields.description: I have a (private) repository repository called "reports". If i try to access this repo under my CNAME domain ( http://scm.fourplusone.de/reports ) i get a 404 error. This error doesn't occur on any other of my (private) repos.
fields.summary: reports repository not found under CNAME domain (BB-714)

fields.description:
There seems to be a tendancy to host projects under a new account such as "mercurialeclipse / main". Currently, this simply shows up as "main" in your newsfeed/home pages. This can get quite confusing when following several projects with a repo of "main" or "stable".

It would be nice to have an option to display username/repo in the newsfeed instead of simply naming the repo.
fields.summary: Prepend username to newsfeed repo names (BB-713)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a default set of openid providers to make logging in much easier for the majority of us using providers such as google, yahoo, openid, facebook, etc.

Having to remember http://google.com/accounts/o8/id every time I wish to login from a new machine can be quite cumbersome. A simple solution would be to have some nice default providers with pretty icons much like StackOverflow does

http://stackoverflow.com/users/login
fields.summary: Add list of openid providers on login screen

fields.description: Clicking on the 'Choose Free Plan' button redirects to PayPal, which throws an error stating an invalid amount has been entered (presumably 0).
fields.summary: Unable to downgrade to free plan

fields.description:
Hello guys!

I've been trying to clone my private repository without success on different scenarios.

I can login at web page without problems ;)

== case 1: with - proxy -- cygwin mercurial ==

{{{\\
$ hg --version\\
Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 1.1)\\
$ python -V\\
Python 2.5.2

$ cat ~/.hgrc\\
[http_proxy]\\
host = 1X.1X.4X.10X:9090\\
passwd = **********\\
user = rselas

$ hg -v clone http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: rselas\\
password:\\
abort: Error

$ cat .wgetrc\\
http_proxy = 1X.1X.4X.10X:9090\\
https_proxy = http://1X.1X.4X.10X:9090\\
proxy_user = "rselas"\\
proxy_password = "**********"

$ wget http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath\\
--2009-06-08 16:47:59--  http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath\\
Connecting to 1X.1X.4X.10X:9090... connected.\\
Proxy request sent, awaiting response... 301 MOVED PERMANENTLY\\
Location: http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath/ [following]\\
--2009-06-08 16:47:59--  http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath/\\
Connecting to 1X.1X.4X.10X:9090... connected.\\
Proxy request sent, awaiting response... 401 UNAUTHORIZED\\
Authorization failed.

$ wget http://rselas:_pass_@bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath\\
--2009-06-08 16:49:34--  http://rselas:_password_@bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath\\
Connecting to 10.15.40.104:9090... connected.\\
Proxy request sent, awaiting response... 301 MOVED PERMANENTLY\\
Location: http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath/ [following]\\
--2009-06-08 16:49:35--  http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath/\\
Connecting to 1X.1X.4X.10X:9090... connected.\\
Proxy request sent, awaiting response... 401 UNAUTHORIZED\\
Authorization failed.\\
}}}

== case 2: with - proxy -- tortoise mercurial ==\\
TortoiseHG 0.7.1

{{{\\
$ ./hg.exe --version\\
Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 1.2.1)

rselas@91773m /cygdrive/c/Archivos de programa/TortoiseHg\\
$ ./hg.exe -v clone http://bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath ~/lamath\\
abort: http authorization required

rselas@91773m /cygdrive/c/Archivos de programa/TortoiseHg\\
$ ./hg.exe -v clone http://rselas:_pass_@bitbucket.org/rselas/lamath ~/lamath\\
abort: authorization failed\\
}}}

Ive tested it at home (without proxy, same versions as before) but same result.

I've tried other sceneraios as well (ssh) I can provide tests if you ask me.

I don't know if Im doing something wrong or it is a server authentication problem.

Regards,

Raúl

This would also be really nice for a distributed team workflow, i.e., there is a bitbucket team for bug fixes, another one for features, another one for usability, all forwarding to an integration repository.

fields.description:
You can't view HTML in repositories on bitbucket.  This makes me sad (I want to display this: http://bitbucket.org/ianb/doctestjs/src/tip/docs/index.html).

Admittedly this would be a big XSS attack vector.  But it would be nice if you could display all files in a repository (no content-disposition) at perhaps another separate domain, where no logins or actions could occur (hence no XSS concern).  Like, oh, bitbucketfiles.org, or probably some better name I'm not thinking of now.
fields.summary: Allow HTML in repositories to be directly viewable

fields.description:
Simple: user cannt commit with generated password after reset.

Full steps:

I "forgot" my password and go to reset page. Fill my user name and press submit button. Then go to my inbox and open big link to confirm reset.

Open command line and try to commit something.\\
{{{\\
#!bash\\
loremaster:therapy xen$ hg push\\
pushing to https://xen@bitbucket.org/xen/therapy/\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: xen\\
password:\\
abort: authorization failed\\
}}}

Then head to http://bitbucket.org/account/password/ and save password again here. And voila its works.

I think this is an issue.
fields.summary: Auth problem after password reset

http://validator.w3.org/feed/
fields.summary: RSS and Atom feeds are not valid (BB-707)

fields.description:
Hi,

The issue is simple really: in the Downloads section, the user is offered .gz and .bz2 files that are really what is usually called .tar.gz and .tar.bz2.

Example:\\
http://bitbucket.org/eigen/eigen2/get/2.0.2.bz2

The user who uses the command-line, seeing a .bz2 file, will be puzzled: should he use

$ bunzip2 file.bz2   # as one normally does with a .bz2 file

or

$ tar xfjv file.bz2  # assuming that the file is really a tar-bz2

?

The answer is that he should do the latter: if he does the former he'll obtain a fine named simply "file" without extension, and he'll have to guess that he has to do "tar xfv file" to untar it.

So, it makes much more sense to have the file named .tar.bz2 in the first place.

Thanks,\\
Benoit
fields.summary: Downloads: extensions .gz and .bz2 should be .tar.gz and .tar.bz2

fields.summary: link to changeset in issue tracker didn't work with CNAME (BB-685)

fields.description:
Given a file with a text MIME type, instead of displaying it in the browser, Safari is forced to download it as an attachment:

{{{\\
$ curl -I http://bitbucket.org/parren/hg-pbranch/raw/pbranch-graphdesc/hgext/pbranch.py\\
HTTP/1.1 200 OK\\
Server: nginx/0.6.32\\
Date: Mon, 18 May 2009 12:30:46 GMT\\
Content-Type: text/x-python\\
Transfer-Encoding: chunked\\
Connection: keep-alive\\
Vary: Cookie\\
Content-Disposition: attachment\\
}}}

The Content-Disposition header should be set to inline or dropped completely for any text/* MIME type that isn't executed by the browser.
fields.summary: Plaintext files are forced to be downloaded as attachments (BB-706)

fields.description:
For example: http://bitbucket.org/parren/
